overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting, starting with data understanding and pattern identification, then evaluating multiple methods before selecting a simple seasonal naive approach due to data limitations and inconsistent trends. The analysis is thorough but ultimately favors simplicity for the 96-hour forecast.
common_data_patterns: Presence of negative values in load data
Hourly frequency without missing values in historical data
key_insights: Identification and prioritization of daily seasonality as the dominant pattern
Manual computation of daily averages to assess trend consistency
Rejection of complex models (e.g., ETS, ARIMA) due to limited historical data (96 points)
Consideration and dismissal of trend-adjusted forecasts after detecting inconsistent daily average changes
Adherence to output formatting specifications including datetime handling and precision
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed data exploration and method evaluation, but reverts to simple heuristics due to data constraints and inconsistent trends.
